thread.title: Air and Rail Travel News: Remodeled Planes at British Airways
thread.title_full: Air and Rail Travel News: Remodeled Planes at British Airways - The New York Times

author: Elaine Glusac
title: Air and Rail Travel News: Remodeled Planes at British Airways
text:
BRITISH AIRWAYS PLANES GET A MAKEOVER
The first of 18 remodeled Boeing 747s was introduced to the British Airways fleet last week on a flight between Heathrow in London and Kennedy in New York. The retrofits, which will be rolled out over the next few months, will feature new seat cushions and coverings as well as something more engaging for passengers: a new Panasonic entertainment system offering more than 1,300 hours of entertainment via more than 130 movies and 400 TV shows on larger, touch-controlled screens. For those who favor using their own devices, each seat will have access to a power outlet. The overhauled jumbos will operate on long-haul flights from London to Boston; Chicago; Dubai; Kuwait; Lagos, Nigeria; and Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.
